elements.content: ‡ Synthesis of 1: a mixture of CuCl2·2H2O (0.1 mmol, 17.0 mg), H3PW12 (0.025 mmol, 70 mg), L (0.05 mmol, 15 mg) and H2O (10 mL) was stirred at room temperature for about 4 hours. The pH of the mixture was adjusted to about 3.0 by adding two drops of hydrochloric acid (1 mol L−1). Then the mixture was transferred into a 23 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel autoclave reactor and heated at 170 °C for 96 hours. After cooling to room temperature at a rate of 10 °C h−1, dark green block crystals suitable for X-ray structural analysis were isolated by ultrasonically cleaning the sample, washing with water several times and drying in air. Yield: ca. 45 % (based on H3PW12). Anal. calcd for C36H49CuN12O48PW12 (%): C, 11.63; H, 1.33; N, 4.52. Found: C, 11.61; H, 1.27; N, 4.49. IR (KBr, cm−1): ν = 3461 (w), 3130 (w), 1612 (m), 1525 (m), 1434 (m), 1282 (m), 1124 (s), 1075 (s), 972 (s), 892 (s), 775 (s), 669 (s), 503 (m).
